## Learn Git

- [Git cheat sheet](https://education.github.com/git-cheat-sheet-education.pdf): Always handy if you don't remember the basic commands for the 
terminal.

- [Learn git concepts, not commands](https://dev.to/unseenwizzard/learn-git-concepts-not-commands-4gjc): Very nice blogpost. Explains really well the concepts of git, also more advanced ones like `rebase` or `cherry-pick`.

- [How to write good commit messages](https://cbea.ms/git-commit/): Explains why good commit messages are important and gives 7 rules for writing them.

- [Git book](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2): Explains git concepts from the very beginning.

### Git :heart: command line

- Follow [this Git training](https://github.com/UnseenWizzard/git_training) for learning the Git
concepts in the command line. 

### Git :heart: R

- There is a whole [book on using Git with R](https://happygitwithr.com/) that 
explains the setup in detail but also goes into more advanced topics.

- Follow this [step by step guide](https://rfortherestofus.com/2021/02/how-to-use-git-github-with-r/)
to set up Git and a GitHub connection in R and R Studio

### Git :heart: GitHub Desktop

- There are detailed step by step guides on how to set up GitHub Desktop and how to
work with in the [GitHub Desktop Documentation](https://docs.github.com/desktop)
